In Asset Accounting you also need 2024 open.

entry.title: Re: Error message: FINOC165 and FINOC297 - Manage Cost Ce...
entry.content: Dear Lakshmipathi, Thank you very much for your extremely detailed and clear response! I truly appreciate the time and effort dedicated to explaining why it's not possible to directly change the Profit Center in S/4HANA due to its status as time-dependent master data, and the system's need to maintain the historical link, even after reversals. This completely clarifies my doubts about the ineffectiveness of reversals in this specific case. Your elucidation regarding the SAP Notes (3477968, 3514994, 3567063) and the difference in message control availability between FPS01 and FPS02 was particularly helpful. I now perfectly understand why I couldn't find those messages in our OBA5 transaction. The three options presented are very valuable and provide a clear path forward: Option A â€“ Profit Center Reorganization: I understand this is the recommended method, and I will investigate the FAGL_REORG* process further. I had previously tried via the app, but without success, so I will attempt it via t-code. Option B â€“ Create a new cost center: This is an alternative that can be considered depending on the scope. I had already suggested this workaround to the client previously. Option C â€“ Upgrade to FPS02 or specific SAP Notes: I will discuss with my team the feasibility of an upgrade or requesting a targeted correction for FPS01. I had also already created an SAP Note for this, and I will inform you as soon as I receive a response. This comprehensive guidance is exactly what I needed to move forward with the solution. Thank you again for your invaluable assistance, kindness, and expertise. Best regards, Acacio

entry.title: Capacity Requirement KPI Not Showing in Schedule Labor App in SAP DMC

SAP Digital Manufacturing 

Dear All,

Iâ€™m currently working with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud integrated with SAP Digital Manufacturing and faced an issue in the Schedule Labor app.

As shown in the screenshot below, the KPI Capacity Requirement stays at 0 hrs. even though:

  • Work center and shift are maintained.

  • Production orders are dispatched.

  • Demand (Planned) and Demand (Scheduled) values are visible.

entry.title: SAP Hardware : OS from RHEL 8.1 to RHEL 8.8 in the cluster environment in AWS
entry.content:
The purpose of this document is to outline the steps taken to update the OS from RHEL 8.1 to RHEL 8.8 in the cluster environment in AWS  . Detailed steps include the following:

  1. Take an AMI of each AWS instance being upgraded.
  2. SPECIFIC FOR Individual system â€“ MAKE SURE TO BACKUP THE FOLLOWING FILE â€“
    1. /lib/ocf/resource.d/heartbeat/< Path for VIP>  
  3. Stop PAS and AAS
    1. sapcontrol -nr 0 -function StopSystem
  4. Stop the app cluster
    1. pcs cluster stop --all
  5. Stop the DB cluster
    1. pcs cluster stop --all
  6. Initiate the OS upgrade on the app cluster â€“ both nodes can be done at the same time.
    1. yum --releaserver=8.8 update
  7. Initiate the OS upgrade on the db cluster â€“ both nodes can be done at the same time.
    1. yum --releaserver=8.8 update
  8. Update the /etc/yum/vars/releasever from 8.1 to 8.8 on all servers after the upgrade is completed.
    1. vi /etc/yum/vars/releasever
    2. 8.8
    3. wq!
  9. Reboot the app cluster hosts ONCE upgrade is complete on BOTH servers.
  10. Reboot the DB cluster hosts ONCE upgrade is complete on BOTH servers.
  11. USE THIS STEP FOR  CLUSTER ONLY
    1. Once both db and app servers are back online post-upgrade. Stop the cluster on both db and app. You will see the IP resource is failing to start.
      1.       pcs cluster stop â€“all
    2. Update the contents of the /lib/ocf/resource.d/heartbeat/aws-vpc-move-ip file taken in step 2 with what you see in the backup file you have (specifically these parameters found at the top of the file). Stage values shown below (PROD WILL BE DIFFERENT for the first parameter).
      1.       OCF_RESKEY_routing_table_role_default=â€arn:aws:iam::885497102981:role/coreerp-tradenext-ec2-roleâ€
      2.       OCF_RESKEY_lookup_type_default=â€NetworkInterfaceIdâ€
    3. After the file is updated on all nodes, start the cluster and the IP resource should assign properly to each node.
      1.       pcs cluster start --all
    4. Validate the DB cluster and App Cluster start in a proper state. 
      1. pcs status

Cluster Status BEFORE UPDATE -

DB

App

Once the AMI is good and the cluster is stopped, perform the steps below in each server.

pcs cluster stop â€“all

yum --releasever=8.8 update

vi /etc/yum/vars/releasever

8.8

Stop App Cluster

Initiate OS Minor Upgrade -

 yum --releaseserver=8.8 update

 

SAS 01

 

 

 Run the update on Node 2 :

Reboot both servers.  Took - 5 min - App Cluster is good -

 DB CLUSTER â€“ Put the cluster in maintenance mode and repeat the steps as in App server .

pcs property set maintenance-mode=true

After OS Update  : Take the cluster out of maintenance mode.

pcs property set maintenance-mode=false

 Testing Cluster to make sure it works prior to OS Upgrade - Must wait for MEM to unload due to defunct WP regarding index server.

Mem Unloading - Node 1

Cluster is communicating -

Stop DB and Reboot OS  respective Hyperscale Console   

 Both Nodes are available after the reboot from AWS console

entry.title: Re: Journal Document upload Error
entry.content:
Hello @JackN11 

Thank you for your message to the community. Let me walk you through it.

The error you experience while maintaining storage category appears because the system cannot find a valid storage category configuration for attachments in your tenant.

You can resolve this by:

Go to your Manage Solution, open the SSCUI for Define Document Types and Storage Categories. Here you must ensure a valid storage category is assigned for the type of attachment you are trying to upload. Manage Documents

Verify your content repository through SAP Document Managment Service. If none is assigned, then that is the cause of the error.

For Journal entry attachments, SAP delivers default storage category. So, check if this is missing in your tenant. If it is, maintain it under the SSCUI mentioned earlier.

Please note, in some tenants, this customizing is restricted. In that case, you must raise an SAP incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and request SAP to activate or assign the missing storage.

The following links will provide more details.

Manage Documents

SAP KBA 2588128

SAP KBA 3404516

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Issues updating journal entry
entry.content:
Hi @JackN11 

The G/L account 10053 is not defined in company code 0D00 means that the account you entered does not exist or is not assigned in the chart of account for the company code you are trying to use.

To resolve that issue, check the following:

  • G/L Account must exist. To confirm, open the Manage G/L Account Master Data app, search for account 100053, if it does not exist then you must create it.
  • If the account exists in the chart of accounts but not for company code 0D00, you must extend it to that company code. Considering you are on the public cloud, you can do this in the manage G/L account master data app.
  • Then make sure the account type and field status are valid for manual postings. If it is a reconciliation account for example for your customers or vendors, you cannot post it directly.

Consult Manage G/L Account Master Data  & Manage Operating G/L Accounts for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Manage Incoming Payment Files will not import valid r...
entry.content:
Hi @P_Quiroz_23 

Thank you for your question.

Please note, when you import BAI files, the system follows a restricted approach because it requires data integrity and consistency for your bank account management reconciliation. If your entry has no present account number in the bank account management, the file you try to upload will be rejected. This is to prevent incorrect processing that could lead to some financial discrepancies.

Currently, SAP does not provide an option for you to import only the valid records and log invalid ones separately in this app.

However, you can consider the following:

  • Request your bank to adjust the BAI file records to only include known account numbers.
  • Alternatively, you can process the BAI files before importing them into SAP. Make sure you separate valid and invalid entries.
  • Make sure you review the error logs that are generated during import to identify and correct wrong entries.
  • Use the manual correction features provided by SAP to handle exception after you have attempted the import.

Consult Payment Rejections & Importing Files Containing Notifications of Rejected Direct Debit Instructions for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Change Language - SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
Hello @Joselubc 

Thank you for your question.

It is important to note that in public cloud modifying or adding national language follows a structured localization approach.  

  • There are currently 34 languages out-of-the-box delivered for around 60 countries by sap. That means for any additional or regional language like the one you seek; you cannot simply change or add it directly as you could in R/3 or on-premise systems.
  • Instead, SAP offers Localization as Self-Service capability. This includes a tool (CLT) which enables you to create or extend local versions to suit your business requirements. Therefore, allowing you to extend existing country localisations or create new local versions.
  • Note that changes must be done in the scope configuration before you can activate it. Direct additional languages outside the one provided by SAP is limited to ensure you maintain consistency, comply with legal requirements and ensures upgradability.

Consult Language Import in SAP S/4HANA,  Determining Display Language & Supported Languages for more details

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud: Professional Service Project Amount...
entry.content:
Hello @BryAguado 

The behaviour you mentioned is correct in S/4HANA Cloud. Please note that credit memos created even with reference to existing posted invoices may not update the project amount if the WBS element linked to the credit memo is included in the work package of your customer project.

The revenue substitution you are seeing is likely due to how your system determines the leading WBS element for revenue posting. In your case, the WBS element to which the credit memo posts are not directly tied to a work package. The mapping and structure of your project might provide answer to the issue.

  • Make sure the WBS elements you reference on the credit memo is part of the work package.
  • Then review your work package definition and make sure it includes all relevant WBS elements for revenue adjustment.
  • Regarding the message in the billing log, it indicated that the system is deriving the revenue posting WBS from a substitution rule or standard logic. Check your project configuration, substitution rules or enhancement logic in the professional services are.
  • You can display, edit and change credit memo requests in the Fiori or manage credit memo request app. This also includes the option to review item references and WBS assignments.

If required, consider creating manual credit memo requests and reference the correct WBS package or reassigning WBS elements within your project.

Consult Customer and Internal Project Management & Entering Customer Invoices and Credit Memos for more details.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: S4 Public Cloud 0L vs 4G configuration
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu 

Consider the following links for that scenario

Foreign Currency Valuation

Advanced Valuation in Financial Accounting

Here are some additions to the customers request/question.

OL is the leading ledger in S/4HANA Cloud. That means all valuations, postings and reporting rely on it. Only on leading ledger is allowed in Public Cloud.

Ledger 4G is the opposite to OL. This means, it is sometimes activated by implementation partners for parallel accounting. This could be for IFRS vs. Local GAAP but is typically used for universal parallel accounting scenarios.

While classic foreign currency valuation is available in some legacy scenarios, for public clouds SAP recommends and delivers the Advanced Foreign Currency Valuation. Once this is activated in a tenant, configurations and posting will be harmonised across ledgers.

So, no you cannot use OL for classic FX and 4G Advanced FX valuation. Considering Foreign currency valuation is a global process, SAP does not allow you split the ledgers.

If the partner has activated 4G then the Advanced FX Valuation is the standard approach to be applied. One consistent FX valuation across all ledgers is the only supported configuration.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Replication from S/4HANA Public Clou...
entry.content:
Hello @FlorisBoon 

Thank you for your question.

Regarding your questions, here are a few facts:

  1. There is no official SAP Note or standard fix that automatically includes the General BP role in DRF payload from S/4HANA Public Cloud. Considering it is a technical role in the backend, it is not released in any API config.
  2. As a workaround on the EWM side, it is possible to implement a BAdI (such as /SCWM/EX_BUPA_INBOUND). This should add the General Role to all incoming Business Partners. This also enriches the payload after receipt and thereby allowing EWM to process the BP correctly even if the General role is missing in the message from S/4
    • If you prefer a custom solution to enhance on the cloud side, note that extension option is limited due to SaaS restrictions.
  3. The scenario you mentioned is not fully covered out-of-the-box for public cloud to decentralized EWM. Custom logic is needed.

I recommend keeping the S/4HANA best practice. You can manage your requirement in EWM.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Accelerating GxP Compliance for SAP Digital Manufacuring in the Public Cloud
entry.content:
The life sciences industry is rapidly adopting SAPâ€™s public cloud offerings. According to McKinsey, over 80% of the top 30 global pharmaceutical and MedTech companies have adopted cloud solutions across various parts of their operations. Key drivers include lower cost of ownership, scalability, and rapid innovation. Another major influence is the advent of AI and Gen-AI, which McKinsey estimates could unlock $60b - $110b a year in economic value for the industry. However, organizations can only leverage Gen-AI at scale if they operate in the cloud. This adoption also come with a key challenge: How can organizations demonstrate GxP compliance in public clouds, when many controls are managed by SAP?

This article explores the adoption journey for public cloud products, using SAP Digital Manufacturing as an example.

Discover and Prepare

Product assessment for Cloud controls

Traditional on-premises compliance strategies were built around physical infrastructures and static environments. In a modern automated public cloud environment, compliance requirements need adaptation. For example:

  1. Backup and Recovery â€“ Life sciences organizations must meet regulatory requirements for backup, including regular snapshots and defined retention schedules. Traditionally, this meant storing daily, weekly, and monthly backups for extended periods. With microservice based environments, older backups lose relevance with every update, limiting restoration usefulness. Organizations should rather adopt a risk-based approachâ€”aligning backup requirements with Recovery Point Objective (RPO) and Recovery Time Objective (RTO) strategiesâ€”to ensure regulatory adherence and true system recoverability.
  2. Network delivery control: Network and perimeter controls should account for business continuity requirements and the latency challenges in distributed cloud environments. Different components of an application may run across geographically distant regions, impacting performance. When evaluating these factors, SAP published service-level agreements (SLAs) should be considered to get guidance on expected network performance and availability.
  3. Data Residency and Sovereignty: Organizations must ensure not only that their data is hosted in compliant regions, but also that backups and replicated environments adhere to the same regulatory and regional requirements.

Supplier Assessment

Life sciences organizations operating under GxP regulations must ensure quality, compliance, and control, even when using public cloud solutions. Under the shared responsibility model, certain application responsibilities are managed by SAP, while others remain with the life sciences organizations. However, the organizations themselves remain fully accountable to regulatory bodies for demonstrating compliance.

Due to the shared or deleted controls, organizations must qualify SAP as a supplier of GxP-relevant IT solutions. Customers may leverage the available information, questionnaires and 3rd party audit reports such as ISO 9001/27001 and SOC2. Additionally, customers may perform an on-site audit to help bridge gaps in understanding of SAPâ€™s Quality Management System and other processes.

To facilitate on-site auditsâ€”such as with SAP Digital Manufacturingâ€”customers can leverage the SAP Quality Requirement Schedule, which grants limited rights to perform an on-site audit and ensures support when life sciences organizations face regulatory audits.

Explore and Realize

GxP Strategy

Following product and supplier assessment, GxP strategy should be defined to ensure long term viability. Key elements of this strategy can include:

  1. Application Architecture: Evaluate which processes remain on-premises and which move to the cloud. Distributed manufacturing workflows spanning ERP (SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud) and MES (SAP Digital Manufacturing) require balancing data duplication, separation of responsibilities, ease of use, performance, and validation requirements.
  2. Extension: Extensions if required must undergo their own GxP evaluation and IQ/OQ/PQ. Consider the various APIâ€™s and dependencies utilized by the extensions and to adhere to clean core principals to ensure minimal PQ efforts over the extension lifecycle.

Partner selection

Many SAP customers leverage partners to accelerate adoption. Partners solutions are available through various marketplaces such as SAP Store, SAP Business Accelerator Hub and Qualified Partner Packages. For software partners, a supplier assessment is recommended to verify their Quality Management processes and that any integrated solution complies with GxP requirements.

Life sciences organizations also rely on implementation partners for consulting, deployment, and ongoing support activities. These partners should be evaluated on their ability to deliver in a GxP-regulated environment. Partner Blogs highlight nice capabilities, providing insight into compliant implementations.

Deploy and Run

Validation Strategy

Validation requirements for a public cloud are similar to on-premises, however these must be adapted to accommodate the fixed release schedule. Key practices that can assist :

  1. Risk Based on Scope and Usage: Leverage SAPâ€™s existing documentation, such as Service Catalog, to define the validation scope based on business criticality and GxP impact. Organizations can exclude non-GxP functions to narrow down the scope of validation testing. Validation efforts should prioritize highly critical functionality, while lower critical functions may be tested through smoke test etc.

For regular release cycles the Whatâ€™s New Viewer can be used to identify changes in functionality that require assessment on validation requirements. Not all new functionalities must be validated â€“ with validation only necessary before the actual usage/adoption of the functionality.

  1. Automation: Automating Computer System Validation (CSV) reduces effort and helps ensure validation is completed on time. SAP Digital Manufacturing provides automation test modules compatible with Tricentis Test Automation (included in Enterprise Support). These automated tests can be leveraged for continuous testing and validation as part of a regression suite.
  2. Leveraging controls from SAP: GAMP5 recommends leveraging supplier testing (post supplier assessment) into verification. Organizations can inherit SAPâ€™s controls based on the shared responsibility model around topics such as infrastructure, platform, security, data integrity etc.

Gen-AI

Generative AI can further reduce the compliance burden. By combining SAPâ€™s structured documentation with a customerâ€™s own documentation, it can generate automated, digitized risk assessments, documentation, and testsâ€”significantly improving both the quality and speed of validation.

Conclusion

Maximizing SAPâ€™s public cloud potential requires rethinking compliance controls. By adopting a risk-based approach and leveraging various tools provided by SAP, life sciences organizations can meet regulatory requirements while accelerating cloud adoption. This approach ensures compliance, fosters innovation, and builds trust in cloud-based operations.

entry.title: Re: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply C...
entry.content:
The ability to perform PGI (Post Goods Issue) in SAP Fiori hinges entirely on the authorization profile, specifically the Business Role and Business Catalog assignments.

So yes, if Sales users lack the catalog that includes the PGI functionality, they wonâ€™t be able to execute PGIâ€”even if they can create deliveries. Thatâ€™s by design: SAPâ€™s role-based access ensures users only perform actions aligned with their responsibilities.

  • Who should have access to PGI?

Typically, PGI is granted to roles such as:

  • Warehouse Clerks or Shipping Specialists â€“ who physically handle goods and confirm dispatch.

  • Logistics Execution Users â€“ responsible for outbound processes.

  • Delivery Processing Roles â€“ if PGI is part of their workflow.

These users would be assigned a Business Role that includes the Business Catalog containing the PGI app (e.g., "Outbound Delivery Processing" catalog). You can fine-tune access further using restriction values like shipping point, plant, or delivery type to ensure users only act on relevant data.

If youâ€™re setting this up, make sure:

  • The correct Fiori app (e.g., Post Goods Issue for Outbound Delivery) is included in the catalog.

  • The catalog is assigned to the right Business Role.

  • The role is assigned to the appropriate Business User.

entry.title: Re: How to control PGI process between Sales and Supply C...
entry.content: To enable Post Goods Issue (PGI) functionality in SAP Fiori, you'll need to assign the correct Fiori app and Business Catalog to the relevant Business Role. Here's the precise info you need: ğŸ“¦ SAP Fiori App for PGI App Name: Post Goods Issue for Outbound Delivery App ID: F1595 Semantic Object: OutboundDelivery Action: PostGoodsIssue This app allows users to post goods issue for outbound deliveries directly from the Fiori Launchpad. ğŸ“š Business Catalog To enable this app, assign the following catalog: Catalog ID: SAP_SD_BC_OUTBOUND_DEL_PROC_MC Catalog Name: Outbound Delivery Processing This catalog includes the PGI app along with other outbound delivery-related apps like Change Outbound Delivery, Display Outbound Delivery, and Create Outbound Delivery. ğŸ‘¤ Who Should Get It? Assign this catalog to roles such as: Shipping Clerk Warehouse Operator Logistics Execution Specialist Sales users typically should not have this catalog unless they are directly involved in logistics execution. This ensures proper segregation of duties and avoids unauthorized PGI actions.

  20. Debugging in ABAP â€“ breakpoints, watchpoints, ST22 dumps

  23. What are the key features of ABAP on HANA?

Why this matters in 2025 (How to Crack SAP ABAP Interview)

SAP technology continues to evolve, especially with ABAP on HANA and S/4HANA migrations. entry.title: Re: In the SAP Public Cloud MTO (Make-to-Order) process,...
entry.content:
For information, in Public Cloud, CBTA is the standard item category for MTO (Makeâ€‘toâ€‘Order) with item category group CB04. CBTA in the delivered scope items is usually set up for orderâ€‘related billing (billing relevance â€œIâ€ â€“ billing plan) rather than deliveryâ€‘related billing. Because of that, there is no standard copying control entry from delivery type LF / item category CBTA to billing type F2; the system doesnâ€™t expect you to bill from the delivery for this process. Hence, F2 is not being created in your case.

SAP Note 3269803 referred here, is a configuration content note that delivers missing copying control entries for certain item categories in S/4HANA Cloud. If your tenant is missing the LF â†’ F2 copying control for CBTA and you want to enable deliveryâ€‘related billing for it, this note is relevant, but, in Public Cloud, you cannot directly maintain VTFL/VTFA; you need to use the corresponding SSCUI or request SAP to adjust via Expert Configuration. The note itself wonâ€™t â€œswitchâ€ CBTA from orderâ€‘related to deliveryâ€‘related billing, but youâ€™d also need to adjust the billing relevance in the item category and align the schedule line category.

If you want deliveryâ€‘related billing for MTO, CBTAâ€™s billing relevance must be changed from â€œIâ€ to â€œBâ€. This is a scope/process change and hence, check if it aligns with your business requirement.

entry.title: Re: S4 Public Cloud 0L vs 4G configuration
entry.content:
Hello @JuliaLu

Yes, that is correct. If the customer requires Universal Parallel Accounting, then the Ledger 4G must be used. The partner should explain to the customer why 4G is required and that all process will follow the advance valuation framework.

If there is no requirement for Universal Parallel Accounting, then 4G should not be activated. Which means that in that case OL remains the leading ledger and all valuation will run against it.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Restricting User-Level Read and Delete Access - Datas...
entry.content:
Hi, I think that the question is more business user oriented. Not developer.

In DSP the DACs control data, but not objects. Only views support DACs anyway, so you cannot add DACs to a table at all. You also cannot allow/disallow access to specific objects to specific users. This is done space-wide. 

If uploading data into DSP via CSV, you assume a developer is uploading, not a business user. So a developer has full access to the table. 

Separated space for each Conso Unit would be the best approach. Another way would be to create a separate Space for CSVs, then for each Conso Unit one table, however this will not restrict the users to see 'other' tables if the want. 

Maybe the best way is to pre-stage the upload into SharePoint. Create an SFTP Connection from DSP to FTP server and upload the files automatically every night via task chain. 

Martin

        lo_oa2c_client->set_token( EXPORTING io_http_client = lo_http_client ).
      CATCH cx_oa2c.
        BREAK-POINT.
    ENDTRY.
ENDTRY.

DATA(ls_payload) = VALUE zmc_s_demo( carrier = 'Demo Carrier'
                                     transportation_mode = '0001'
                                     transportation_order = 'Demo Order'
                                     transportation_order_exec_sts = '07'
                                     transportation_order_type = 'Outbound'
                                     transportation_order_uuid = 'cd88888c-292b-44a8-bb9a-888888888814'
                                     transportation_shipping_type = 'Demo Type'
                                     __before-transportation_order_exec_sts = '04' ).

DATA(lv_payload) = /ui2/cl_json=>serialize( data        = ls_payload
                                            pretty_name = /ui2/cl_json=>pretty_mode-camel_case ).

DATA lv_payload_x TYPE xstring.

CALL FUNCTION 'SCMS_STRING_TO_XSTRING'
  EXPORTING
    text   = lv_payload
  IMPORTING
    buffer = lv_payload_x.

cl_http_utility=>set_request_uri( EXPORTING  request = lo_http_client->request
*                                  uri     = '/messagingrest/v1/queues/Default/D40100EMMulSft/1/Default/D40100EMMulSft/1/FreightOrder/messages/consumption' ).
*                                  uri     = '/messagingrest/v1/queues/sap/s4/beh/FreightOrder/ExecStatusChanged/v1/messages' ).
                                  uri     = '/messagingrest/v1/topics/sap/s4/beh/FreightOrder/ExecStatusChanged/v1/messages' ).
*                                  uri     = 'sap/s4/beh/FreightOrder/ExecStatusChanged/v1' ).
*                                  uri     = 'Default/D40100EMMulSft/1/Default/D40100EMMulSft/1/FreightOrder' ).

lo_http_client->request->set_method( 'POST' ).
lo_http_client->request->set_content_type( 'application/json' ).
lo_http_client->request->set_data( lv_payload_x ).

lo_http_client->send(
    EXCEPTIONS
      http_communication_failure = 1
      http_invalid_state         = 2 ).

lo_http_client->receive(
  EXCEPTIONS
    http_communication_failure = 1
    http_invalid_state         = 2
    http_processing_failed     = 3 ).

DATA lv_response TYPE string.
lv_response = lo_http_client->response->get_cdata( ).

IF lv_response IS NOT INITIAL.
  BREAK-POINT.
ENDIF.

lo_http_client->response->get_status( IMPORTING code = DATA(lv_code) ).

WRITE: lv_code.

entry.title: JWT token in CAPM Application does not contain the custom attributes of IAS
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

I am facing issue in getting the custom attributes of  SAP Cloud identity services in CAPM application JWT Token. I have seen the logs of CIS. the issueJwtToken (troubleshoot using https://me.sap.com/notes/3472611) contains the custom attributes, but in the CAP application , the JWT token does not contain those attributes. Is any configuration  needs to be done in xs-security.json of CAP application to receive those attributes?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: Why no Delete options for Comments, Answers, Posts, Q...
entry.content:
Hi @Sijin_Chandran - this is mainly due to EU's Digital Services Act as @Dominik_Tylczynski also mentions. 

To stay DSA compliant, we need to always create a DSA case when content is deleted, and inform the author of why the content was deleted. Delete permissions are complex (even on the old platform you were only allowed to delete content as long as it had no children, ie. no comments or answers). To ensure DSA compliance, the delete persmissions were therefore restricted to the SAP Community team moderators last year when DSA went into effect. 

Having said that, we are continously reviewing options and evaluating our moderation practices within all the different regulations that are being introduced globally currently. (other than DSA in the EU, we now also have similar regulations either already in place, or emerging, in the UK, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Vietnam, China, India, South Korea, Japan, Brazil and California)

entry.title: The delivery date in the schedule line of the sales order item is appearing incorrectly.
entry.content: In Public cloud We have created a new plant, 5002. However, when I create a sales order from this plant, the delivery date in the itemâ€™s schedule line is incorrect. For example, if I create a sales order on 13.09.2025, the delivery date is automatically set to 17.09.2025. If I use any other plant, the delivery date is correct. Please suggest a solution.

entry.title: IDoc 0000000000075134 and determined transport type EXTPAY do not match
entry.content:
Hi Experts

I am working on IHC in S4H 2023 . I want to pay external vendor with F110 . When I look into WE02 I am getting the error 51 IDoc 0000000000075134 and determined transport type EXTPAY do not match.

Please help resolve the issue

Thanking you

Rajeev Uppal

entry.title: How to collaborate on an entity of a draft enabled RAP Business Object ?
entry.content:
Introduction

With the latest release 2508 of SAP BTP ABAP Environment a new feature called Collaborative Draft has been delivered.  This feature allows that several users can work on the same draft instance of an entity of a RAP Business Object. 

So similar like collaborating on a file in Microsoft Teams it is now possible that several users can perform changes on an entity of a RAP Business Object at the same time.

The cool thing is that every draft enabled RAP BO can be enhanced so that it also supports Collaborative Draft without the need to change the existing ABAP code of your behavior implementation class(es). It is only required to change a few lines of code in the behavior definition, the behavior projection and you have to create a draft query view  which projects all fields of the draft table. of the "authorization master" entity which in most cases this is the root entity of your business object.

In case your active business object view entity is protected by a DCL (which is strongly recommended for every productive RAP business object ğŸ˜‰)  the draft query view must also be protected by a data control language (DCL).

Please note:  
As described in the section Outlook the implementation will become even easier in the future once table entities will be supported as a draft persistency.   

Prerequisites

  1. You need a draft enabled RAP Business object (which you can easily generate using the new "from scratch generator").
  2.  Your user and any other user that is supposed to use / test your RAP BO must have the new business catalog  SAP_CORE_BC_RAP_DRAFT_PC assigned which is part of the business role template
    SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE. 
    You have hence first to ask your administrator to either generate an additional role based on the role template SAP_BR_EMPLOYEE or let the administrator assign the business catalogue to an existing role which is assigned to developers on your SAP BTP ABAP Environment system, so that you and your colleagues can start developing and testing this cool new feature.

Result

In the following you see me (Andre Fischer) and the user ANZEIGER working on the same instance of a draft entity. As soon as a user leaves the focus of a field the changes will be updated automatically in the UI of the other user.

You can test the collaborative draft setup even in systems where you have just one user, like in our trial systems.

In the first screen shot I am editing the field "Notes" (highlighted in red) and I can see that I am editing the field "OrderID" in the second tab (highlighted in green).

In the second screen shot we see vice versa that I am there editing the field "OrderID" (highlighted in red) and that I am editing the field notes in the other session in the first tab.

Implementation Steps

A step by step guide which describe how to enhance an existing draft enabled RAP Business Object has been provided for your convenience to the SAP Online Help.

An example of a RAP Business Object has also been delievered as part of the well known Flight Reference Sample with the latest version in Github which now contains an additional sub package /DMO/FLIGHT_COLLDRAFT.

Implementation Walkthrough

I will add a few screen shots on how I have enabled my small RAP BO using the above mentioned documentation. As shown in the following screen shot only the behavior definition and the behavior projection have to be changed and two additional objects, the draft query view for the draft table of the root entity and the DCL for the draft query view have to be created.

1. Changes in the behavior Definition

As described in the documentation the we have specify in the behavior definition that collaborative draft is used instead of exclusive draft and for the root entity we have to add the use of the draft query view for the draft table and we have to add the action Share.

2. Changes in the behavior projection

In the behavior projection we simply have to add use statements so that the collaborative draft is used for our RAP business object and we have to enable the action Share.

3. Create new object - Draft Query View

4. Create DCL for the Draft Query View

Outlook

In future releases, when table entities will be supported to store the draft data it will not be necessary anymore to create a draft query view for the draft table. This is because in this case the table entity can be directly secured by a DCL.

The setup shown in this blog post will be presented in upcoming events such as the sitBE Event in Mechelen, the DevToberFest and naturally TechEd and TechConnect events later this year.

DevToberFest Sample

And you can find the code of the sample application which shows a Shopping Cart with a header and a child entity for items that I will use in this blog post soon in Github as well. 

For the implementation I used the "from scratch generator" and as a template for the root entity I used the following structure

@EndUserText.label : 'Shopping Cart Header Data'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
define structure zdmo_cart_## {

  currency                : abap.cuky;
  notes                   : abap.char(100);
  order_id                : abap.numc(8);
  requested_delivery_date : fins_caldate;
  @Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'zdmo_cart_##.currency'
  total_price             : abap.curr(11,2);

}

while for the child entity this structure was used

@EndUserText.label : 'Shopping Cart Item Data'
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE
define structure zdmo_item_## {

  item_id         : abap.numc(8);
  ordered_item    : matnr40;
  quantity        : abap.numc(4);
  currency        : abap.cuky;
  @Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'zdmo_item_##.currency'
  item_price      : abap.curr(11,2);
  @Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'zdmo_item_##.currency'
  item_unit_price : abap.curr(11,2);

}

entry.title: Re: The delivery date in the schedule line of the sales o...
entry.content:
The system calculates the confirmed delivery date in the schedule line by running delivery scheduling and transportation scheduling. The calculation uses:

  • Shipping point lead times (picking/packing time, loading time)
  • Route transit time (if a route is determined)
  • Transportation lead time
  • Factory calendar for the plant and shipping point

If plant 5002 is new, itâ€™s very likely that:

  • The shipping point assigned to plant 5002 has default lead times (e.g., 2 days picking + 2 days loading), or
  • The route determination for plant 5002 â†’ customer is assigning a route with a transit time of 4 days, or
  • The factory calendar for plant 5002 has nonâ€‘working days between 13.09.2025 and 17.09.2025, which pushes the first possible goods issue date forward.

Thatâ€™s why you see a 4â€‘day gap for plant 5002, but not for other plants.

entry.title: Re: IDoc 0000000000075134 and determined transport type E...
entry.content: The error "IDoc and determined transport type EXTPAY do not match" (IHC_IDOC639) occurs because the system cannot correctly determine that your payment is an external payment. The most common root cause is missing SWIFT/BIC code in the master data of the external vendor's bank. The system uses this code to distinguish between internal (TRANSF) and external (EXTPAY) payments.

entry.title: TM PPF Output Management for Business Partners (partner dependent action)
entry.content:
We use S/4HANA 2023 FPS02 and I have a TM related questions. We are in the shipper scenario.

We defined the freight order output (the PDF which we send to our carrier for the transport service) as action. It works.

We recognized that we can set an action as partner-dependent. This makes sense, because we want to send the freight order only to our carriers.

We set our action for the freight order as "Partner dependent". The action is only relevant for U3 Carrier.

Now it does not work any more.

The output configuration guide Output Management Configuration Guide says that you need to redefine  GET_COMM_PARNR_BY_ABAP to get the partners. OK, wired enough that you need to code such a basic requirement, but we did it.

 

The action is now determined âœ… in the FO, but the execution fails, because the system does not determine the default communication method (E-Mail, Print), language,... everything what was "standard" in NAST. We assume that's the issue.

The help documentation Output Management for Business Partners | SAP Help Portal explains that there is an Output Management area in the Business Partner (BP). We configured all data sets, screen groups and screens, included everything in the BP role....but, we cannot find the "Output Management" fields in the BP transaction. We assume, there you can define required information for the action. Are we wrong? Is this Output Management tab part of S/4 or only a relict of old TM?

Does anyone have a few more information for us how we can achieve to get the carrier communcation details automatically into the FO? Before we start with redefinition of many methods in the PPF "toolbox" we were wondering if there is any out of the box logic to send an email to the carrier.

Thank you

entry.title: Re: TM PPF Output Management for Business Partners (partn...
entry.content: @Ronald_Knienieder The issue is not a bug but a fundamental architectural difference. In the old NAST world, output parameters were stored statically in the Business Partner (BP) master data. In the new PPF world, these parameters must be determined dynamically at runtime by redefining specific methods in the PPF agent class. The "Output Management" tab in the BP is a relic of the NAST era and is not used by TM's PPF output management in S/4HANA.The solution is to enhance the standard PPF agent class for the Freight Order business object to provide the missing communication data (method, address, language) by reading it from the correct parts of the BP master data.

entry.title: Re: TM PPF Output Management for Business Partners (partn...
entry.content:
The Output Management tab in the Business Partner was not part of NAST. For NAST, I defined in condition records how the partner shall receive the output (channel, language). I don't see this as "oldfashioned" ğŸ˜‰

Thanks of course for your reply. I hope there is still some other feedback that we can easily determine the output channel w/o ABAP. I mean, it's a standard solution and using classes/methods/Badis....not really sure if this is the way to go for a really basic requirement.

entry.title: Re: What is the best approach in SAP ECC to transfer asse...
entry.content: @Gourav_Deshmukh The optimal and standard SAP-recommended approach is to use the automated intercompany asset transfer transaction (ABT1N). You do not need to align or deactivate areas 70 and 71 in the receiving company code. Instead, you will leverage SAP's Cross-System Depreciation Areas configuration to explicitly define which areas transfer their values. By leaving areas 70 and 71 unassigned in this configuration, they will be seamlessly excluded from the transfer process.Attempting to manually retire and acquire the asset is error-prone, misses automatic reconciliation features, and is not best practice for this scenario

entry.title: Re: TM PPF Output Management for Business Partners (partn...
entry.content: You are right, the old way was not "old-fashioned" it was a different, highly effective architecture.The classic NAST (Message Control) framework did not rely on the BP's Output Management tab for default values. Its power and flexibility came from the condition technique
